author: Business Wire
title: Riverbed to Launch Next-Generation AI-Powered Observability Solutions During April 8 Webcast Event; Follows 102% Observability Bookings Growth in Q1 '25
text:
REDWOOD CITY, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Riverbed, the leader in AIOps for observability, today announced it will unveil several significant AI innovations and new data observability solutions, in a Global Webcast event taking place on April 8 in the Americas and EMEA regions, and April 9 in APJ. You can register to attend the Webcast here . The new solutions will deliver even greater value for the Riverbed Platform, and build on strong market momentum—with Riverbed observability bookings growth of 102% year-over-year (YoY) in Q1 2025, and overall bookings growth of 90% YoY, including 59% growth of Acceleration bookings.
"We’re excited to share in our upcoming Launch Webcast a powerful set of new AI capabilities and observability solutions that will enable customers to consolidate their IT tools, deploy AI that delivers ROI, and feed their enterprise data repositories,” said Dave Donatelli, CEO of Riverbed Technology. “We’re seeing strong customer adoption of the Riverbed Platform, and are proud to have achieved 102% year-over-year bookings growth of our Observability solutions in Q1 2025. We are also pleased to see our Acceleration bookings grow 59% year-over-year. We appreciate the trust our customers place in Riverbed, and are committed to continuing to innovate at a rapid pace to meet enterprises’ most pressing needs and deliver substantial benefits for their organizations.”
About Riverbed
Riverbed, the leader in AIOps for observability, helps organizations optimize their user’s experiences by leveraging AI automation for the prevention, identification, and resolution of IT issues. With over 20 years of experience in data collection and AI and machine learning, Riverbed’s open and AI-powered observability platform and solutions optimize digital experiences and greatly improves IT efficiency. Riverbed also offers industry-leading Acceleration solutions that provide fast, agile, secure acceleration of any app, over any network, to users anywhere. Together with our thousands of market-leading customers globally – including 95% of the FORTUNE 100 – we are empowering next-generation digital experiences. Learn more at riverbed.com
Riverbed and certain other terms used herein are trademarks of Riverbed Technology LLC. All other trademarks used herein belong to their respective owners.
Connect with Riverbed
Facebook LinkedIn Riverbed Blog Riverbed Partner Blog Riverbed Community X / formerly Twitter (@Riverbed) (@RiverbedPartner) YouTube
Contacts
MEDIA CONTACT
Shawn Dainas
Riverbed Technology
shawn.dainas@riverbed.com

author: Aidan McGrath; December
title: Schefter: Browns' Amari Cooper (heel) now inactive for Week 17
text: Schefter: Browns' Amari Cooper (heel) now inactive for Week 17 The Cleveland Browns have ruled out Amari Cooper (heel) for Thursday's Week 17 game against the New York Jets. Cooper appeared to be trending in the right direction for tonight's game against the Jets' elite defense, but evidently wasn't able to do enough in the team's pregame warmups to suit up for the game. He'll take the weekend off to recover as the Browns gear up for playoff push. Cooper's absence could lead to even more targets for tight end David Njoku, but also for wideouts Elijah Moore and Cedric Tillman. Njoku should be the top priority for the Browns' passing game, and has a $6,600 salary to go with his 9.2-FanDuel-point projection. author: Ramkumar
title: Tamil Nadu rains: 54 cm rain in just 24 hours, Tirunelveli reels under floods |video|
text:
[Tamil Nadu News](https://www.news9live.com/state/tamil-nadu)
Tamil Nadu rains: 54 cm rain in just 24 hours, Tirunelveli reels under floods |video|
The flooding has severely impacted daily life in Tirunelveli and Tenkasi districts. Tirunelveli city's bus stand was inundated, resembling a flooded forest, while stagnant water on roads hindered movement.
Tirunelveli: Heavy rainfall has caused flooding in Tirunelveli district in Tamil Nadu, with Manjolai receiving 54 cm of rainfall in just 24 hours, flooding the Manimuthar River and forest streams. The inflows to Tamirabarani via tributaries like Ramanathi and Kadananathi reached 41,000 cusecs at Suthamalli dam, with 1,500 cusecs released downstream. Visuals of courtallam water falls overflowing due to heavy rains in the region,
குற்றாலம் ஐந்தாம் அறிவியல் வெள்ளப்பெருக்கு..
[#TirunelveliRains]| [#CourtallamFalls] [pic.twitter.com/EOPpPPh2r7]Also Read
— நீதிமான் (@Neethiman3)
[December 12, 2024]
In the wake of surge of water levels in key rivers and dams in the region authorities have advised residents near Thamirabarani and tributaries to stay alert, secure essentials, safeguard livestock and follow government advisories. The officials said the relief camps are being set up for those in low-lying areas. Due to incessant rains, 50,000 cubic feet of water is flowing into the Thamirabarani river. This has caused severe flooding and the Tirunelveli Junction bus stand and surrounding areas are submerged in water.Water flow in Thamirabarani river
[#Thamirabarani]river [#TirunelveliRains] [pic.twitter.com/nBJZRO2eQe]
— Thinakaran Rajamani (@thinak_)
[December 13, 2024]
The heavy rain, triggered by a deep depression in the Bay of Bengal, started at 5 am yesterday, initially as a light drizzle, intensifying into heavy rain. Intermittent drizzle occurred throughout the day, followed by heavy rain that continued till night.
As of 5:30 am today, rainfall recordings showed 249 mm in Manalmedu, 203 mm in Tirunelveli, 230 mm in Tenkasi, 238 mm in Ramanathi Dam area and 312 mm in Kadayanallur Ayakudi area. Sengottai recorded 240 mm, Gundar 208 mm and most areas received over 100 mm.
The flooding has severely impacted daily life in Tirunelveli and Tenkasi districts. Tirunelveli city’s bus stand was inundated, resembling a flooded forest, while stagnant water on roads hindered movement.
தென்காசி மாவட்டம் ஆலங்குளம் தற்போது வரை 30 சென்டிமீட்டர் மழை பதிவாகியுள்ளது ..
அனேக வீடுகளில் தண்ணீர் புகுந்து வெள்ளப்பெருக்கு ஏற்பட்டுள்ளது
[@ChennaiRains] [@kalyanasundarsv] [@MasRainman] [@praddy06] [@ramanathan4548] [@kaj29a] [pic.twitter.com/wOWEiKsXQH]
— narayanan weather man (@narayananweath1)
[December 13, 2024]
Tirunelveli, Tenkasi and Thoothukudi districts experienced heavy rain from yesterday morning till today. The region remains on high alert, with continued rainfall expected.
Heavy rains batter in Tenkasi
Tenkasi district has been experiencing continuous heavy rainfall, leading to flooding in several areas. As of 7 AM, Ayikudi received 31 mm, Sengottai 24 mm, and Tenkasi town 23 mm of rain. The downpour has caused the Kuttralam Main Falls to overflow, exacerbating the flooding in surrounding regions. Authorities are monitoring the situation as water levels rise in various parts of the district.
Tirunelveli rains: Helpline numbers issued
The people of Tirunelveli district have been notified of monsoon emergency helpline numbers. The public can use these in times of emergency. Accordingly, District Emergency Control Center – 1077, 0462 – 2501012
District Police 0462 – 2562500, 99527 40740
City Police 0462 – 2562651, 89399 48100
Fire and Rescue Services – 0462 – 2572099, 73050 95952
Electricity related complaints – 94987 94987
Medical queries – 104
Emergency medical assistance – 108
Helpline for the differently-abled – 0462 – 2573267
Click for more latest
[Tamil Nadu news](https://www.news9live.com/state/tamil-nadu). Also get top headlines and [latest news](/latest-news) from [India](/india) and around the [world](/world) at News9.

author: @FrankieMuBert
title: Todos los juegos de Nintendo Switch 2: de Mario Kart World a Duskbloods pasando por los clásicos de Gamecube
text:
¿A qué vamos a jugar tú y yo en Nintendo Switch 2? La Gran N arropa su nueva consola con un catálogo de lanzamiento muy sólido capitaneado por el nuevo Mario Kart e incluso se atreve a mirar a 2026 dejando caer propuestas tan potentes como Duskbloods, la nueva maravilla de fantasía oscura de From Software que huele a Bloodborne 2 y que será completamente exclusivo del sistema. Dos vendeconsolas en toda regla.
Ante ese bendito dilema, una solución: en VidaExtra te hemos reunido en un mismo sitio todos los juegos anunciados y confirmados. Y sí, también hemos tenido en cuenta

author: archyworldyscom
title: Another threat to Florida from “Milton”
text:
MIAMI (EFE).- The governor of Florida , Ron De Santis, yesterday declared a state of emergency in 35 counties in anticipation of the foreseeable impact of the tropical storm” Milton ,” which would reach the west coast of this southern state by the middle of next week, perhaps in the form of a major hurricane.
The emergency declaration will allow us to accelerate preparations for the expected effects of “Milton”, which would make landfall Florida as a Category 3 or higher hurricane.
These preparations come as recovery efforts continue following the September 26 impact of the powerful Category 4 hurricane “Helene,” which left at least 227 dead and hundreds missing across six states.
“We will continue to mobilize state resources to prepare for effective search and rescue operations, restoring power and clearing roadways,” DeSantis said in a post on his official X account yesterday.
Him National Hurricane Center (NHC, in English) from the United States yesterday predicted that Storm “Milton,” which today has maximum sustained winds of 40 mph, will become a hurricane tonight and tomorrow, and that it “could become a major hurricane as it moves across the central and eastern Gulf of Mexico” headed to Florida.
THE Federal Emergency Management Agency ( FEMA ) yesterday alerted Floridians that storms and heavy rain could occur in the state, especially in areas that have already been affected by “Elena”, which has since already become the deadliest in the United States “Katrina”, which in 2005 caused more than 1,800 deaths.
Among the counties included in the executive order signed by DeSantis there are also those in central Florida, right where the theme parks of Walt Disney World and that they may close in anticipation of the effects of “Milton”, according to local media.
#threat #Florida #Milton

author: ANI
title: Himachal: BJP President JP Nadda offers prayers at temple before casting his vote in Bilaspur | Politics
text: Himachal: BJP President JP Nadda offers prayers at temple before casting his vote in Bilaspur The four Lok Sabha constituencies in Himachal Pradesh -- Kangra, Mandi, Hamirpur, and Shimla--are polling in a single phase on June 1. [ANI](/ani-stories)| Updated: 01-06-2024 10:14 IST | Created: 01-06-2024 10:14 IST - Country: - India Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) national president JP Nadda along with his wife Mallika Nadda offered prayers at a temple near his residence, in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur on Saturday, ahead of casting their votes in the seventh phase of Lok Sabha elections. Nadda was also spotted feeding cows at a cowshed in Bilaspur ahead of exercising his franchise. The four Lok Sabha constituencies in Himachal Pradesh -- Kangra, Mandi, Hamirpur, and Shimla--are polling in a single phase on June 1. In addition to the Lok Sabha elections, by-polls are also being held in six Himachal Pradesh assembly seats on the same day. These seats fell vacant after the disqualification of rebel Congress MLAs. The by-poll results are crucial for the future of the Sukhvinder Sukhu government in the state, which received a jolt after the Congress Rajya Sabha candidate, Abhishek Manu Singhvi, lost against BJP's Harsh Mahajan despite the former party having more MLAs in the state. The seventh and final phase of polling in the largest festival of democracy started on Saturday as voting started in the last 57 parliamentary constituencies at 7 am across seven states and the Union Territory of Chandigarh. The seventh phase marks a grand finish to the world's largest polling marathon that began on the 19th of last month and has already covered six phases and 486 Lok Sabha seats. According to the Election Commission of India, over 10.06 crore electors including approximately 5.24 crore male, 4.82 crore female and 3574 third gender electors are expected to exercise their franchise. (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) ALSO READ [Is Ro Khanna running for president? Yes says his Indian American colleagues in Congress](/article/entertainment/2941421-is-ro-khanna-running-for-president-yes-says-his-indian-american-colleagues-in-congress) [Soccer-FIFA Congress to choose Women's World Cup host, seek racism penalties](/article/sports-games/2941482-soccer-fifa-congress-to-choose-womens-world-cup-host-seek-racism-penalties) [Soccer-FIFA Congress to choose Women's World Cup host, Palestine FA urges Israel suspension](/article/sports-games/2941559-soccer-fifa-congress-to-choose-womens-world-cup-host-palestine-fa-urges-israel-suspension) ["They will run bulldozer on Ram Temple": PM Modi blasts Congress-SP combine in UP's Barabanki](/article/politics/2941677-they-will-run-bulldozer-on-ram-temple-pm-modi-blasts-congress-sp-combine-in-ups-barabanki) [Soccer-Brazil declared host of 2027 Women's World Cup at FIFA Congress](/article/headlines/2941598-soccer-brazil-declared-host-of-2027-womens-world-cup-at-fifa-congress)

author: Stephen Grata
title: Ball State hires new head soccer coach
text:
MUNCIE, Ind. – After a tough end to the season and a head coach's departure in the offseason, the Ball State soccer team was in the hunt for new leadership ahead of their next season. On March 11, it was announced that the position had been filled by Andy Stoots.
As a seasoned collegiate coach with 22 years of experience, Stoots felt that Ball State was the perfect place to start his first head coaching campaign.
“I’ve been doing this a long time, and certainly being a first-time head coach there are things we’re going to learn no doubt about it, but I’ve worked for a lot of really good head coaches so I do feel prepared in that way,” Stoots said.
After a three-year stint with the University of Missouri as their associate head coach, Stoots brings a championship-oriented mindset with him to Ball State.
“That’s why we play, we play because we’re competitive and because we want to win championships at the end of the year,” Stoots said.
On top of wanting to win championships, Stoots said he was drawn to Ball State because of the people he met on campus.
“From my first conversations with Jeff [Mitchell] and his staff, I was really blown away with the people first and foremost… that really reeled me in,” Stoots said.
After the Cardinals lost their last five games, Stoots said he is ready to implement his own play style.
“Something really exciting, we want to play, if we can, a really fast-paced and attacking style of game… I think it's a style that players want to be a part of… and I think our fans are going to really enjoy it also,” Stoots explained.
Fans can get a glimpse of the new Cardinal team in the Fall when their season kicks off at Briner Sports Complex.
